title: Fuel Tank - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.

body.body: Never drain fuel from the tank using non-approved, non-professional standard fuel handling equipment. A fire causing destruction of property and injury to persons may result from use of non-approved fuel handling equipment.
Using proprietary professional automotive workshop equipment approved for fuel handling, drain all fuel from the fuel tank.
Release the fixings securing the front of the fuel tank to the frame.
Remove the fixings securing the fuel tank trim panels to the rear of the fuel tank.
Fuel tank trim panel (left hand side shown)
Partially raise the front of the fuel tank and detach the trim panel front retaining clip from the fuel tank.
Carefully manoeuvre the trim panel forwards to detach it from the two side retaining clips.
Fuel tank trim panel (left hand side shown)
Remove the fixing securing the rear of fuel tank to the rear subframe.
Withdraw the spacer sleeve from the rear subframe.

body.name: Fuel tank rear fixing sleeve chxl

body.body: Slightly raise the front of the fuel tank, no greater than 20Â°, and then lift the fuel tank horizontally to gain access to fuel lines and electrical connectors.
With the aid of an assistant, disconnect the electrical connections to the fuel pump and the fuel level sensor.
If the fuel rail is dismantled without first reducing pressure, fuel may escape causing clothing and components to be coated with fuel.
This would represent a serious fire hazard which could lead to burn injuries and damage to property.

Because fuel stored in the fuel rail will be at 3.5 bar pressure, it is essential that the fuel pressure is reduced before any dismantling of the fuel rail takes place. To reduce pressure, briefly crank the engine with the fuel pump disconnected.
When disconnected, the fuel tank is self-sealing but a small amount of fuel may dribble from the hose.
Have an assistant reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first, and crank the engine to reduce pressure in the fuel rail.
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first.
Ease the latch away from the connector until the release buttons are exposed.

body.name: Fuel line double check clip cekp_1

body.body: Disconnect the fuel hose by squeezing the sides of the connector and pulling the hose free from its spigot on the fuel pump plate.
Before disconnection, note the position of the two breather hoses so that they can be returned to the same locations when refitting the tank.
Remove the fuel tank from the frame.
